csharp.using: System, System.Collections.Generic, System.Text, System.Diagnostics, System.Xml.Serialization, DISnet.DataStreamUtilities

class.name: AngularVelocityVector
class.comment: 5.2.2: angular velocity measured in radians per second out each of the entity's own coordinate axes.

class.name: AntennaLocation
class.comment: 5.2.3: location of the radiating portion of the antenna, specified in world coordinates and entity coordinates.

attribute.name: antennaLocation
attribute.comment: Location of the radiating portion of the antenna in world coordinates

attribute.name: relativeAntennaLocation
attribute.comment: Location of the radiating portion of the antenna in entity coordinates

class.name: BeamAntennaPattern
class.comment: Section 5.2.4.2. Used when the antenna pattern type field has a value of 1. Specifies the direction, patter, and polarization of radiation from an antenna.

attribute.name: beamDirection
attribute.comment: The rotation that transformst he reference coordinate sytem into the beam coordinate system. Either world coordinates or entity coordinates may be used as the reference coordinate system, as specified by teh reference system field of the antenna pattern record.

attribute.name: azimuthBeamwidth
attribute.commment: Full width of the beam to the -3dB power density points in the x-y plane of the beam coordinnate system. Elevation beamwidth is represented by a 32 bit floating point number in units of radians.

attribute.name: referenceSystem
attribute.commment: The reference coordinate system wrt which beam direction is specified. This field should not change over the duration of an exercise. World coordindate systemis prefered for exercises. The entity coordinate system should be used only when highly directional antennas must be precisely modeled.

attribute.name: ez
attribute.comment: Magnigute of the z-component in beam coordinates at some arbitrary single point in the mainbeam and in the far field of the antenna.

attribute.name: ex
attribute.comment: Magnigute of the x-component in beam coordinates at some arbitrary single point in the mainbeam and in the far field of the antenna.

attribute.name: phase
attribute.comment: THe phase angle between Ez and Ex in radians.

class.name: SphericalHarmonicAntennaPattern
class.comment: Section 5.2.4.3. Used when the antenna pattern type in the transmitter pdu is of value 2. Specified the direction and radiation pattern from a radio transmitter's antenna. NOTE: this class must be hand-coded to clean up some implementation details.

attribute.name: order
attribute.commment: The highest order of the expansion in spherical harmonics, couting from zero. There are 2n+1 coefficients for each order n, and a total of N^2 + 2N + 1 coefficients through order N.

class.name: ArticulationParameter
class.comment: Section 5.2.5. Articulation parameters for movable parts and attached parts of an entity. Specifes wether or not a change has occured, the part identifcation of the articulated part to which it is attached, and the type and value of each parameter.

class.name: BurstDescriptor
class.comment: Section 5.2.7. Specifies the type of muntion fired, the type of warhead, the type of fuse, the number of rounds fired, and the rate at which the roudns are fired in rounds per minute.

attribute.name: munition
attribute.comment: What munition was used in the burst

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.comment: how many of the munition were fired

attribute.name: rate
attribute.comment: rate at which the munition was fired

class.name: ClockTime
class.comment: Section 5.2.8. Time measurements that exceed one hour. Hours is the number of hours since January 1, 1970, UTC

class.name: EmitterSystem
class.comment: Section 5.2.11. This field shall specify information about a particular emitter system

attribute.name: emitterName
attribute.comment: Name of the emitter, 16 bit enumeration

attribute.name: function
attribute.comment: function of the emitter, 8 bit enumeration

class.name: SimulationAddress
class.comment: Section 5.2.14.1. A Simulation Address record shall consist of the Site Identification number and the Application Identification number.

class.name: EntityType
class.comment: Section 5.2.16. Identifies the type of entity, including kind of entity, domain (surface, subsurface, air, etc) country, category, etc.

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc)

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: specific
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field

class.name: Orientation
class.comment: Section 5.2.17. Three floating point values representing an orientation, psi, theta, and phi, aka the euler angles, in radians

class.name: EventID
class.comment: Section 5.2.18. Identifies a unique event in a simulation via the combination of three values

class.name: FixedDatum
class.comment: Section 5.2.18. Fixed Datum Record

class.name: FundamentalParameterData
class.comment: Section 5.2.22. Contains electromagnetic emmision regineratin parameters that are variable throughout a scenario dependent on the actions of the participants in the simulation. Also provides basic parametric data that may be used to support low-fidelity simulations.

attribute.name: frequency
attribute.comment: center frequency of the emission in hertz.

attribute.name: frequencyRange
attribute.comment: Bandwidth of the frequencies corresponding to the fequency field.

attribute.name: effectiveRadiatedPower
attribute.comment: Effective radiated power for the emission in DdBm. For a radar noise jammer, indicates the peak of the transmitted power.

attribute.name: pulseRepetitionFrequency
attribute.comment: Average repetition frequency of the emission in hertz.

attribute.name: pusleWidth
attribute.comment: Average pulse width of the emission in microseconds.

attribute.name: beamAzimuthCenter
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam azimuth an elevation centers and corresponding half-angles to describe the scan volume

attribute.name: beamAzimuthSweep
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam azimuth sweep to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamElevationCenter
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam elevation center to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamElevationSweep
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam elevation sweep to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamSweepSync
attribute.comment: allows receiver to synchronize its regenerated scan pattern to that of the emmitter. Specifies the percentage of time a scan is through its pattern from its origion.

class.name: RadioEntityType
class.comment: Section 5.2.25. Identifies the type of radio

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc)

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: nomenclatureVersion
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field

class.name: SupplyQuantity
class.comment: Section 5.2.30. A supply, and the amount of that supply. Similar to an entity kind but with the addition of a quantity.

class.name: VariableDatum
class.comment: Section 5.2.32. Variable Datum Record

class.name: Vector3Float
class.comment: Section 5.2.33. Three floating point values, x, y, and z

class.name: Vector3Double
class.comment: Section 5.3.34. Three double precision floating point values, x, y, and z

class.name: EntityID
class.comment: Each entity in a given DIS simulation application shall be given an entity identifier number unique to all other entities in that application. This identifier number is valid for the duration of the exercise; however, entity identifier numbers may be reused when all possible numbers have been exhausted. No entity shall have an entity identifier number of NO_ENTITY, ALL_ENTITIES, or RQST_ASSIGN_ID. The entity iden- tifier number need not be registered or retained for future exercises. The entity identifier number shall be specified by a 16-bit unsigned integer. An entity identifier number equal to zero with valid site and application identification shall address a simulation application. An entity identifier number equal to ALL_ENTITIES shall mean all entities within the specified site and application. An entity identifier number equal to RQST_ASSIGN_ID allows the receiver of the create entity to define the entity identifier number of the new entity.

class.name: EightByteChunk
class.comment: 64 bit piece of data

class.name: ModulationType
class.comment: Radio modulation

class.name: DeadReckoningParameter
class.comment: represents values used in dead reckoning algorithms

attribute.name: deadReckoningAlgorithm
attribute.comment: enumeration of what dead reckoning algorighm to use

attribute.name: otherParameters
attribute.comment: other parameters to use in the dead reckoning algorithm

class.name: Pdu
class.comment: The superclass for all PDUs. This incorporates the PduHeader record, section 5.2.29.

attribute.name: pduType
attribute.comment: Type of pdu, unique for each PDU class

attribute.name: protocolFamily
attribute.comment: value that refers to the protocol family, eg SimulationManagement, et

attribute.name: length
attribute.comment: Length, in bytes, of the PDU

class.name: EntityInformationPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.3. Common superclass for EntityState and Collision PDUs. This should be abstract.

class.name: EntityStatePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.3.1. Represents the postion and state of one entity in the world

attribute.name: entityID
attribute.comment: Unique ID for an entity that is tied to this state information

attribute.name: articulationParameterCount
attribute.comment: How many articulation parameters are in the variable length list

attribute.name: entityType
attribute.comment: Describes the type of entity in the world

attribute.name: entityLinearVelocity
attribute.comment: Describes the speed of the entity in the world

attribute.name: entityLocation
attribute.comment: describes the location of the entity in the world

attribute.name: entityOrientation
attribute.comment: describes the orientation of the entity, in euler angles

attribute.name: entityAppearance
attribute.comment: a series of bit flags that are used to help draw the entity, such as smoking, on fire, etc.

attribute.name: marking
attribute.comment: characters that can be used for debugging, or to draw unique strings on the side of entities in the world

attribute.name: articulationParameters
attribute.comment: variable length list of articulation parameters

class.name: CollisionPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.3.2. Information about a collision

attribute.name: issuingEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that issued the collision PDU

attribute.name: collidingEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of entity that has collided with the issuing entity ID

attribute.name: location
attribute.comment: Location with respect to entity the issuing entity collided with

class.name: Warfare
class.comment: Section 5.3.4. abstract superclass for fire and detonation pdus that have shared information

attribute.name: firingEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that shot

attribute.name: targetEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that is being shot at

class.name: FirePdu
class.comment: Sectioin 5.3.4.1. Information about someone firing something

attribute.name: munitionID
attribute.comment: ID of the munition that is being shot

attribute.name: burstDescriptor
attribute.comment: Describes munitions used in the firing event

class.name: DetonationPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.4.2. Information about Stuff Exploding

attribute.name: munitionID
attribute.comment: ID of muntion that was fired

attribute.name: locationInWorldCoordinates
attribute.comment: where the detonation is, in world coordinates

attribute.name: numberOfArticulationParameters
attribute.comment: How many articulation parameters we have

class.name: LogisticsPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.5. Abstract superclass for logistics PDUs

class.name: ServiceRequestPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.5.1. Information about a request for supplies

attribute.name: servicingEntityID
attribute.comment: Entity that is providing the service

class.name: ResupplyOfferPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.5.2. Information about a request for supplies

attribute.name: numberOfSupplyTypes
attribute.comment: how many supplies are being offered

class.name: ResupplyReceivedPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.5.3. Receipt of supplies is communiated

attribute.name: numberOfSupplyTypes
attribute.comment: how many supplies are being offered

class.name: ResupplyCancelPdu
class.comment: Section 5.2.5.4. Cancel of resupply by either the receiving or supplying entity

class.name: RepairCompletePdu
class.comment: Section 5.2.5.5. Repair is complete

class.name: RepairResponsePdu
class.comment: Section 5.2.5.6. Sent after repair conplete PDU

class.name: SimulationManagementPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6. Abstract superclass for PDUs relating to the simulation itself

attribute.name: receivingEntityID
attribute.comment: Entity that is intended to receive message

class.name: CreateEntityPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.1. Create a new entity

class.name: RemoveEntityPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.2. Remove an entity

class.name: StartResumePdu
class.comment: Section 5.2.6.3. Start or resume an exercise

attribute.name: realWorldTime
attribute.comment: UTC time at which the simulation shall start or resume

attribute.name: simulationTime
attribute.comment: Simulation clock time at which the simulation shall start or resume

class.name: StopFreezePdu
class.comment: Section 5.2.3.4. Stop or freeze an exercise

attribute.name: realWorldTime
attribute.comment: UTC time at which the simulation shall stop or freeze

attribute.name: reason
attribute.comment: Reason the simulation was stopped or frozen

attribute.name: frozenBehavior
attribute.comment: Internal behavior of the simulation and its appearance while frozento the other participants

class.name: AcknowledgePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.5. Acknowledge the receiptof a start/resume, stop/freeze, or RemoveEntityPDU

attribute.name: responseFlag
attribute.comment: Whether or not the receiving entity was able to comply with the request

class.name: ActionRequestPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.6. Request from simulation manager to an entity

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: ActionResponsePdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.7. response to an action request PDU

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: DataQueryPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.8. Request for data from an entity

attribute.name: timeInterval
attribute.comment: time issues between issues of Data PDUs. Zero means send once only.

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: SetDataPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.9. Change state information with the data contained in this

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: DataPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.10. Information issued in response to a data query pdu or a set data pdu is communicated using a data pdu.

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: EventReportPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.11. Reports occurance of a significant event to the simulation manager

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: CommentPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.6.12. Arbitrary messages can be entered into the data stream via use of this PDU

attribute.name: fixedDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatums
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable length datums

class.name: DistributedEmissionsPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.7. Electronic Emmisions

class.name: ElectronicEmmisionsPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.7.1. Information about active electronic warfare (EW) emissions and active EW countermeasures shall be com- municated using an Electromagnetic Emission PDU.

attribute.name: stateUpdateIndicator
attribute.comment: This field shall be used to indicate if the data in the PDU represents a state update or just data that has changed since issuance of the last Electromagnetic Emission PDU [rela- tive to the identified entity and emission system(s)].

attribute.name: numberOfSystems
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the number of emission systems being described in the current PDU.

attribute.name: systemDataLength
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the length of this emitter system’s data (including beam data and its track/jam information) in 32-bit words. The length shall include the System Data Length field.

attribute.name: numberOfBeams
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the number of beams being described in the current PDU for the system being described.

attribute.name: emitterSystem
attribute.comment: This field shall specify information about a particular emitter system

attribute.name: location
attribute.comment: Location with respect to the entity

attribute.name: beamDataLength
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the length of this beam’s data (including track/ jam information) in 32-bit words. The length shall include the Beam Data Length field

attribute.name: beamIdNumber
attribute.comment: This field shall specify a unique emitter database number assigned to differentiate between otherwise similar or identical emitter beams within an emitter system.

attribute.name: beamParameterIndex
attribute.comment: This field shall specify a Beam Parameter Index number that shall be used by receiving entities in conjunction with the Emitter Name field to provide a pointer to the stored database parameters required to regenerate the beam.

attribute.name: fundamentalParameterData
attribute.comment: Fundamental parameter data such as frequency range, beam sweep, etc.

class.name: DesignatorPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.7.2. Handles designating operations

attribute.name: codeName
attribute.comment: This field shall specify a unique emitter database number assigned to differentiate between otherwise similar or identical emitter beams within an emitter system.

attribute.name: designatedEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity being designated

attribute.name: designatorCode
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the designator code being used by the designating entity

attribute.name: designatorPower
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the designator output power in watts

attribute.name: designatorWavelength
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the designator wavelength in units of microns

attribute.name: designatorSpotWrtDesignated
attribute.comment: designtor spot wrt the designated entity

attribute.name: designatorSpotLocation
attribute.comment: designtor spot wrt the designated entity

class.name: RadioCommunicationsPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.8. Abstract superclass for radio communications PDUs.

attribute.name: entityId
attribute.comment: ID of the entitythat is the source of the communication

class.name: TransmitterPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.8.1. Detailed information about a radio transmitter. This PDU requires manually written code to complete.

attribute.name: modulationParameterCount
attribute.comment: how many modulation parameters we have

attribute.name: modulationParametersList
attribute.comment: variable length list of modulation parameters

attribute.name: antennaPatternList
attribute.comment: variable length list of antenna pattern records

class.name: SignalPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.8.1. Detailed information about a radio transmitter. This PDU requires manually written code to comnplete.

class.name: ReceiverPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.8.3. Communication of a receiver state.
